uk.ac.uea.framework.implementation

Class AndroidGPS

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.uea.framework.implementation.AndroidGPS
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GPS

    public class AndroidGPS
extends java.lang.Object
implements GPS
    Class that handles the GPS tracking of a device, given a Context and a period, the number of seconds between each location update. Created by Caine on 31/01/2016.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AndroidGPS

        public AndroidGPS(Context c,
          int period)
        Constructor for a GPS tracker. Creates an instance of LocationManager and a LocationListener to enable location updates. Also sets how often the device's current location is updated.
        Parameters:
        c - The context of the current Activity
        period - The number of seconds between each location update.

        public void startUpdates()
        Starts the updates via the listener for the active GPS location

      • getCurrentLocation

        public Location getCurrentLocation()
        Description copied from interface: GPS
        Returns the device's current location. A check must be put in place to assure the returned location is not null.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentLocation in interface GPS
        Returns:
        current location

      • setPeriod

        public void setPeriod(int period)
        Sets period of time to update
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • proximityCheck

        public boolean proximityCheck(double range,
                     Location destination)
        Checks the proximity of you to the destination
        Specified by:
        proximityCheck in interface GPS
        Parameters:
        range - The minimum distance required to be "within range" of the destination.
        destination - The location the device is travelling to.
        Returns:
        true if if the distance is less than the range
